name: More Pop Music Hits: 1960-1963 Online Trivia | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which African city was mentioned in the second verse of the 1962 hit song "You Belong to Me" by The Duprees?
questions.explanation:
Algiers.

	The Duprees achieved success in August 1962 with a song called "You Belong to Me." In the second verse of this tune, lead vocalist Mike Kelly sang these lyrics: "See the marketplace in old AlgiersSend me photographs and souvenirsBut remember when a dream appearsYou belong to me..." In the USA, The Duprees' version of this song rose to the number seven spot on the singles charts.

questions.text: In 1961, Dion recorded a rock 'n roll classic song called "Runaround Sue." Please supply Dion's last name.
questions.explanation:
DiMucci.

	Dion Francis DiMucci was born in New York City in July 1939. DiMucci's song "Runaround Sue" climbed to the top of the U.S. Billboard singles charts in October 1961. Dion also achieved success with a single called "The Wanderer." Dion sang these lyrics from "Runaround Sue": "Ask any fool that she ever know, they'll sayAh-keep away from a-Runaround Sue, yeah..."

questions.text: In 1962, Brian Hyland sang, "Yes, it's gonna be a cold, lonely summer." Which song contained this line?
questions.explanation:
Sealed With a Kiss.

	The song "Sealed With a Kiss" by Brian Hyland featured the line about a "cold, lonely summer." Hyland was born in New York City, and he reached the number three spot on the U.S. Billboard singles charts in June 1962 with "Sealed With a Kiss." Hyland sang these words: "Yes, it's gonna be a cold, lonely summerBut I'll fill the emptinessI'll send you all my dreams everyday in a letterSealed with a kiss..." "Midnight in Moscow" was recorded by Kenny Ball, "I Can't Stop Loving You" was performed by Ray Charles, and "Ramblin' Rose" was recorded by Nat King Cole.

questions.text: Which singer had a hit song in 1960 with "Only the Lonely"?
questions.explanation:
Roy Orbison.

	"Only the Lonely" was a hit song for Roy Orbison. This song reached the number two position on the U.S. Billboard charts in the summer of 1960. The Texas-born Orbison wailed, "Only the lonely know the way I feel tonight / Only the lonely know this feelin' ain't right..."

questions.text: Which one of these dances was NOT mentioned in the lyrics to Chris Montez's 1962 hit "Let's Dance"?
questions.explanation:
The Philly.

	Chris Montez of California reached the number four position on the 1962 U.S. Billboard singles charts with "Let's Dance." This tune featured a lively organ and drum beat; it was used in the food fight scene of the popular 1978 movie "Animal House." In the chorus, Montez urged dancers to do "the Twist, the Stomp, the Mashed Potato, too." Montez never specifically mentioned the Philly in "Let's Dance."

questions.text: Which singing group reached the number two spot on the U.S. charts in 1963 with "Be My Baby"?
questions.explanation:
The Ronettes.

	The Ronettes hailed from New York City, and they reached the number two spot on the U.S. singles charts in the fall of 1963 with the classic pop song "Be My Baby." This song featured the "wall of sound" production of Phil Spector as well as the vibrant vocals of Ronnie Spector (Veronica Bennett), Estelle Bennett, and Nedra Talley.

questions.text: What was the little boy's name in the 1962-63 Peter, Paul & Mary song "Puff, The Magic Dragon"?
questions.explanation:
Jackie.

	Peter, Paul & Mary reached the number two spot on the U.S. Billboard charts in the spring of 1962 with "Puff, The Magic Dragon." This song mentioned the special relationship between Puff and a little boy named Jackie Paper. Jackie and Puff were close friends during Jackie's childhood, but Jackie outgrew Puff when the boy grew older. Peter, Paul & Mary sang these words: "A dragon lives forever, but not so little boysPainted wings and giants' rings make way for other toysOne grey day it happened; Jackie Paper came no moreAnd Puff that mighty dragon, he ceased his fearless roar..."

questions.text: Which one of these songs was a 1963 top ten hit in the U.S. for The Crystals?
questions.explanation:
Then He Kissed Me.

	The Crystals, from New York City, reached the number six spot on the U.S. Billboard singles charts in the fall of 1963 with "Then He Kissed Me." This tune featured the production work of Phil Spector and the lead vocals of Dolores Brooks. Can you remember these lyrics from "Then He Kissed Me"? "When we danced, he held me tightAnd when he walked me home that nightAll the stars were shining brightAnd then he kissed me..." Skeeter Davis sang "The End of the World", Jimmy Gilmer and The Fireballs recorded "Sugar Shack", and Lesley Gore sang "Judy's Turn to Cry."

questions.text: According to the lyrics of the 1961 song "Travelin' Man", where did Ricky Nelson have a "China doll" waiting for him?
questions.explanation:
Hong Kong.

	Ricky Nelson had a "China doll" waiting for him Hong Kong, according to the lyrics of his April 1961 number one hit song "Travelin' Man." This song mentioned Nelson's various lovers around the world. Nelson, born in New Jersey, sang these words: "And my China doll down in old Hong KongWaits for my returnPretty Polynesian baby over the seaI remember the nightWhen we walked in the sands of WaikikiAnd I held you oh so tight..."

questions.text: In 1961, "Pretty Little Angel Eyes" was a hit single for Curtis ______.
questions.explanation:
Lee.

	"Pretty Little Angels" was an uptempo doo-wop hit for Curtis Lee in July 1961. Lee was born in Arizona, and he teamed up with The Halos on "Pretty Little Angel Eyes." This song reached the number seven position on the U.S. Billboard single charts. Lee sang these words: "Angel eyes, I really love you soAngel eyes, I'll never let you goBecause I love youMy darlin' angel eyesPretty little, pretty little angel eyes..."
